article.title: Poisonous Plants
article.desc: Some of the following plants can be toxic to your cat. Check with your veterinarian before having them in your home.

article.title: Why do I need to keep my pet away from antifreeze?
article.desc: Antifreeze makes your car run better in the summertime and wintertime, but it’s dangerous to your pet.

article.title: Could the pesticides and fertilizers I use on my lawn be dangerous to my pet?
article.desc: If you plan to use pesticides or fertilizers on your lawn, be mindful of your cat or dog.

article.title: If my pet eats something poisonous, what should I do?
article.desc: If your pet swallows poison, you have to decide whether to treat him at home ...

article.title: Is it dangerous for my pet to nibble on houseplants?
article.desc: Your pet might have a passion for houseplants, but some common varieties can make your pet sick, and a few may even be deadly.

article.title: What common outdoor plants are poisonous to pets?
article.desc: Ornamental plants add color to our lawns, but some of them pose a hidden danger to our pets.

article.title: What is tooth resorption?
article.desc: Tooth resorption is a dental condition in which an animal develops a lesion in the crown or root of a tooth.

article.title: Do dogs and cats get TMJ problems the way humans do?
article.desc: The temporomandibular joint, or TMJ, is a hinge joint that lets your jaw open and close.

article.title: At what age can my cat become pregnant?
article.desc: If you’ve just introduced an un-spayed kitten into your household, you may want to know when her feline biological clock will start ticking.

article.title: What are the first signs of pregnancy in a cat?
article.desc: Pregnancy in cats lasts about nine weeks. But early signs are easy to miss.

article.title: My cat is going to have kittens. What possible complications should I look for?
article.desc: Autumn Davidson, a Veterinary Internist at the University of California-Davis says cats have very few problems giving birth,

article.title: My cat is going to have kittens, what happens during a normal delivery?
article.desc: The week before labor begins, provide your pregnant cat with a warm, quiet area, and lots of towels.

article.title: Is it true that a single litter can include kittens from multiple sires?
article.desc: When a cat is in estrus - or heat as it is commonly known - she will have one item on her agenda... mating.

article.title: What are some possible reasons for infertility in a male cat?
article.desc: Infertility in male tomcats is not usually a problem - unless you’re a cat breeder with a valuable, champion tom that can’t fulfill its reproductive obligations.

article.title: How can I stop my cat from using my houseplants as litter boxes?
article.desc: If your cat lived outdoors, she would naturally use the dirt to urinate or defecate.

article.title: Why has my cat suddenly stopped using the litter box?
article.desc: If your cat stops using the litter box, don’t punish him - try to find out why.

article.title: How do I train an outdoor cat to start using an indoor litter box?
article.desc: If your cat lived outdoors, she would naturally use the dirt to urinate or defecate.

article.title: What might I consider when choosing a litterbox for my cat?
article.desc: Litterboxes may all look more or less the same to you, but probably not to your cat.

article.title: Understanding your Cat's Body Condition
article.desc: While some pet owners think a fat cat is a healthy cat, there are easy ways to find out if your cat has the ideal body condition.

article.title: What are the three main feline body types?
article.desc: Cats come in such a huge variety of shapes and sizes that it might seem difficult to classify them.

article.title: My cat is losing weight even though she eats well. What could be the problem?
article.desc: Is your older cat high-strung? Does she lose weight but eat like a pig?

article.title: My cat has been losing a lot of weight recently, even though her diet hasn't changed. What might be the problem?
article.desc: Has your cat been shedding more pounds than hair lately? Is her rich fur coat looking dull? These could be signs of roundworm.

article.title: Why is obesity so dangerous for pets?
article.desc: For years, antibiotics have been used to destroy bad bacteria in a pet’s body.

article.title: How do I know if my cat is overweight?
article.desc: Humans aren’t the only ones living large. The obesity epidemic is affecting our cats, too.

article.title: How can I help my cat lose weight?
article.desc: Does your cat have an apron of fat where his figure-eight waist ought to be?

article.title: What should I look for in the food for a cat that needs to lose weight?
article.desc: What's one all-American solution to feline obesity? An Atkins - or "catkins"-style diet for cats. Veterinarian Margee Scherk, Editor of the Journal of Feline Medicine and Surgery, approves.

article.title: My cat is slightly overweight. How much weight can she safely lose in a month?
article.desc: Pet owners who equate food with love may literally be killing their cats with kindness. Feline obesity leads to a host of diseases, including premature death.

article.title: How can I get my fat and lazy cat to exercise?
article.desc: Just like humans, cats can lose weight by exercising. Veterinarian Margee Scherk, Editor of the Journal of Feline Medicine and Surgery, says there are a lot of ways to get an obese cat up and moving.

article.title: What are some possible causes of weight loss in cats?
article.desc: If your cat is shedding pounds - not just fur - it's important to get him checked out by a veterinarian.

article.title: Emergency First Aid Tips
article.desc: In an emergency, keep a level head and quickly get your cat to the veterinarian. Call first.

article.title: Home Safe Home
article.desc: Even cats that spend most of their time indoors may be exposed to a number of potential hazards.

article.title: I'm putting a first aid kit together for my pet, what should I include?
article.desc: You never know when you might have an emergency with your cat or dog, so it’s important to know what to include in a pet safety kit.
